text:
Hello and welcome to Cupcake Addiction's Candy
Crush Saga Cakepop Tutorial where I'll be

showing you how to make this great cakepop
that looks just like the Candy Crush Saga
app icon.

Tools and equipment that we will be using
today:

I'm just using a polystyrene block to rest
my Candy Crush Saga cakepop in.
I've got a couple of zip lock bags.
A pair of scissors.
I've got a cakepop ball.

Now if you don't have a great recipe to get
your cakepop balls to this stage, ready to

dip and decorate, I will leave a link to our
recipe and tutorial in the description box

below
I've got some melted blue chocolate or candy
melts.
Melted white chocolate.
Melted dark chocolate.
Melted pink candy melts.
A knife.
And a spoon.
I've got a few sprinkles.
In Australia, we call these hundreds and thousands.
But they're just brightly colored round sprinkles.

And a little tiny piece of wax paper or greaseproof
paper.
Some red Jelly Belly jelly beans.

So long as they're the small jelly beans,
whatever brand they are, doesn't particularly
matter.
I've got some orange Skittles.
You can also use M&Ms.

I've got a couple of different options for
creating our little, I guess, our little sparkly
jewel candy effect.

But this option here is just a Nestle [morsel]
or a chocolate chip.
And I've got a couple of lollipop sticks.
So let's get started.

Now the first thing that we want to do is
prepare our cakepop ball.
So you've got your regular round cakepop ball.

We all know how to get them to this round
shape.

And as I said, if you don't, I will leave
a link to our tutorial in the description
box below.

What you want to do is just take your hands
and just flatten it out.

So you're just flattening it out into, I guess,
a little bit of a disc.

Now take that and just smack it out on the
bench once and then twice.
So you want to do both sides of that.
You want to smack it down nicely.

Now take your knife and we'll just going to
cut it into a square, so just cutting the
4 sides off.

It's a little bit smaller than a regular cakepop
because we are cutting those little edges
off.
So you will get more out of a cakepop mix.

Now bear in mind, when you cut it, you are
going to drag the edges down a little bit.

So make sure that you keep in mind where the
front and the back is.

That's going to be the back of my Candy Crush
Saga icon or app icon.

And this lovely, flat side here is going to
be the front.

So we're going to pop that one off into the
refrigerator for about 15 minutes until it's

really really firmly set and it's nice and
hard.

To save us time today, I've got one here that
I have pre-refrigerated.
So there you've got your square cakepop.

And as you can see, when I push it, it doesn't
push out of shape.

So you really do want it to be quite firmly
refrigerated.

Now I'm going to take one of those lollipop
sticks.

And I'm just going to dip it into that blue
candy melt.

And we're going to insert it into the bottom
of the square.
Now do try to be careful here.

Make sure that you look at it as you're inserting
it because you do want to insert that stick
as in line as possible.

I've found with some of mine, they ended up
a little bit wonky on the top of the stick.

So just wipe off any excess so you that you've
got a nice, thin seal and not that big, thick
seal that we would normally have.

And we're just going to pop that off to the
side.

I would normally pop it in the fridge but
today because I know it's quite cool, I'm

just going to let the chill of the cakepop
square refrigerate it and set that little
chocolate seal for us.

Alright, now I'm going to show you two different
ways that you can make these little gems or

these, I guess, the little colorful balls
that are on the logo.

One of them is just taking a regular chocolate
chip, popping it into the microwave for 30
seconds.

Now that chocolate chip is designed to hold
its shape under intense heat such as when
you put it into the oven.

So it's not going to completely melt but it
is going to get wet and wet enough for you
to be able to sprinkle your sprinkles on top.
They will stick to it.
Put it in the fridge let it completely set.
That's how I've prepared these two.

The other way that you can do this is take
a little bit of greaseproof paper.

And I'm just going to dip a lollipop stick
and literally just pop a bit of a blob melted
dark chocolate unto that piece of paper.

And look, it pretty much resembles one those
chocolate chips if you look at it.

And then take some of your sprinkles and just
sprinkle them on top.
And pop them off into the fridge to set.

So that's the second way that you can make
your nice, little gem-shaped, I guess, candy,

your gem-shaped candy for your Candy Crush
Saga cakepop.

Alright, so I'm happy now that this seal is
going to have set, as I mentioned, that wall
is nice and cold.
So it's time to dip.
And you can decide here.
You can see here, I've made mine double sided.

So if you want to put the candy on both sides,
you can or if you do want to have it on one
side, it's completely up to you.

So I'm going to take my blue chocolate or
blue candy melts.

And I'm going to give them a nice stir just
so that there as fluid as they can possibly
be before I start dipping.
And then I'm going to take my cakepop.

I'm used to saying cakepop ball but it's not
a ball at all today, it's a square.
So take my cakepop, dip it in.

and when I tap this one off, I just want to
tap it sort of on one side, and then flip
it over, and on the other side.

And that's just going to help us retain that
lovely square shape.

Alright, now don't go too crazy on the tapping
and all those sorts of things because you

do want to sort of attack this one while it's
reasonably wet.

So I'm going to take one of my Skittles and
you want this as centered as you can.
I'm going to take my...

I actually really don't know what to call
this.
In Australia, we'd call it the freckle.

It's a name of the candy over here that looks
very much like that but I'm not sure that
they would call it on there.
See there I'm just positioning.
So I've put down the Skittles first.

Then I've popped down my little sparkly one
and then the jelly bean is really just overlapping
a little bit.

So turn it around, we'll do the same on the
other side -- Skittle, little jewel, and make

sure that you don't have the Jelly Belly logo
showing, and pop down that jelly bean.

So now we want to let that completely set
and then we'll come back and we'll do the
edging.

Alright, so I'm happy that my little blue
coating there is set.
And this is a little bit optional.

So the actual Candy Crush Saga app has this
kind of pink and white striping around the
sides but it is quite time-consuming to do.
It's not hard but it is time-consuming.

So you can just leave it there and you've
got your Candy Crush Saga candy cakepop or
you can take your zip lock bag.

Now I preferred to do the white chocolate
first.

So I'm just going to take a lollipop stick
and just use that to give my chocolate a little
stir and dip it into the bag.

So you want to take your zip lock bag and
just cut a nice little tip off the end, not

too crazy thin but also don't go too thick
so you want to be able to have a little bit
of control over it.

And we're just going to pipe some lines on
to the top.

So with these lines, you want to make sure
that they come just slightly over the front

of either side so that you can see them when
you look at the cakepop front on.

And you want to pipe them at the same distance
apart, with enough space in the middle to
come back and do our pink lines.

Alright, as you get down to the bottom, you
just want to do 2 little half stripes just
on either side there so you've got...

It doesn't have to be particularly neat but
you sort of got your white stripes going all

the way around the outsides of your Candy
Crush Saga logo.

So pop that up in the polystyrene block to
dry.
And pop in some pink.

If you love this tutorial, make sure that
you head on over to our My Cupcake Addiction.
We've got lots and lots of tutorials.

We upload several times a week and we would
love to have you drop by and see what else

we're coming up with in the world of cupcakes
and cake decorating.

And if you're already subscribed to my channel,
I hope you like this tutorial and thanks for
subscribing.

So once again, we're just going to do the
same thing, just cut off a nice, little tip,

little bit of a piping bag, and we'll go and
fill in all of those gaps.

When you do come to filling in the gaps, it's
not going to be quite as easy as when you

did your first ones but you are going to have
a bit of a guide.

So you just take the tip of your piping bag
and just sort of almost push it down.

You can even take your finger and just run
it along the top.

So it almost perfectly fills in that little
gap and that's going to give us that really
nice stripe effect.

And you can also just pop the other side and
just sort of rest your fingers up against

it just to make it quite nice and neat as
you look at it from the front on view.

And then just [pipe] in right in there [of
that stick], and smooth it off.

So there you have your Candy Crush Saga app
logo cakepop.
Try saying that ten times fast.

And warning: this is highly addictive as with
the app game itself.
Thanks very much for watching.
I hope you love this cakepop.
